translations.translation: Truly it is revelation sent down by the Lord of all the worlds.
And this (Qur'an) is a revelation from the Lord of all the worlds,
Indeed this is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe;
This, (Quran), is certainly the revelation from the Lord of the Universe.
And indeed this Qur’an has been sent down by the Lord Of The Creation.
And truly, this is a revelation from the Lord of all that exists,
And most surely this is a revelation from the Lord of the worlds.
Truly it is the revelation of the Lord of all Being,
And lo! it is a revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,
This surely is a revelation from the Lord of the Universe:
And verily it is a revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
This is indeed [a Book] sent down by the Lord of all the worlds,
Verily this is a Revelation from the Lord of the Worlds:
And truly, this (the Quran) is a revelation from the Lord of the 'Alamin (mankind, jinns and all that exists),
Truly, it is the sending of the Lord of the Worlds.
It is a revelation from the Lord of the Worlds.
And indeed, the Qur'an is the revelation of the Lord of the worlds.
[26:192] Truly it, the Qur’ān, is the revelation of the Lord of the Worlds,
(And lo! it is) i.e. the Qur'an (a revelation) an address (of the Lord of the Worlds),

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text: { وَإِنَّهُ } أي: القرآن { لَتَنزِيلُ رَبِّ ٱلْعَالَمِينَ } [الشعراء: 192] كالكتب السالفة

commentaries.author: ابن عجيبة
commentaries.text:
قلت: " آية " خبر " كان " 
 و " أَنْ يعلمه ": اسمها
 ومن قرأ " آية " بالرفع فآية اسمها
 و { أن


 } إلخ: خبر أو " كان ": تامة
 و " آية ": فاعل
 و " أن يعلمه ": بدل منه
 يقول الحق جل جلاله: { وإنه } أي: القرآن المشتمل على القصص المتقدمة
 وكأنه تعالى عاد إلى ما افتتح به السورة من إعراض المشركين عما يأتيهم من الذكر
 ليتناسب المفتتح والمختتم
 أي: وإن القرآن الكريم { لتنزيلُ ربِّ العالمين } أي: منزل من جهته
 ووصفه تعالى بربوبية العالمين للإيذان بأن تنزيله من أحكام ربوبيته للعالمين ورأفته للكل
